content.content: Women die from sepsis during pregnancy, childbirth and after delivery. 12.8% of pregnancy-related deaths are from sepsis in the US.[^123] Embedded content: https://youtu.be/7f_FxKGEk4E ## Risk Factors: - Cesarean section - Preterm delivery - Postpartum hemorrhage - Placenta retention after birth - Multiple births (like twins or triplets) - Mastitis (breast infection) - Chronic illness (like diabetes) - Miscarriage - Abortion - Invasive tests [^124] Embedded content: https://youtu.be/AEGUCpxwAlE Embedded content: https://youtu.be/GU2oiAczTq8 ## Prevention: - Routine vaccinations - Healthcare providers washing their hands - Cesarean section - Knowing the signs of infection (fever, foul-smelling discharge, redness, pain, &/or bleeding) - Follow instructions for vaginal care &/or surgical incision care - Wash your hands before vaginal care &/or surgical incision care[^124] [Sepsis and Pregnancy & Childbirth from the Sepsis Alliance](https://www.sepsis.org/sepsis-and/pregnancy-and-childbirth/) [^123]: Centers for Disease Control & Prevention (CDC). Reproductive Health. Pregnancy Mortality Surveillance System. CDC Website. https://www.cdc.gov/reproductivehealth/maternalinfanthealth/pregnancy-mortality-surveillance-system.htm. Updated August 7, 2018. Accessed September 27, 2018. [^124]: Sepsis Alliance. Sepsis and Pregnancy & Childbirth. Sepsis Alliance website. https://www.sepsis.org/sepsis-and/pregnancy-and-childbirth/.
